column5: Right on Stevie R to the OW botham!  Solid lac truite!

I started the day off on the north side of Kempenfelt and found only 2.5 - 3 inches of ice.  I set up and hooked a small laker which I lost at the hole, but I got SWARMED by people, drilling 20-30 feet away all around me.  By the way, you dont need a gas auger on 2.5 inches of ice, you could probably just stomp through it.  Anyways after I had 10 people surrounding me and water coming up my holes I said to hell with it, and left for a different area.  Met up with a group of friends and headed out, set up by 9:30 ish.  Very slow day, but I did manage a tank of a laker.  I have lost some big fish on Simcoe ove the years, they just always manage to get the best of me.  This time, I finally got the big one.  I lost one last week that was bigger, so it still doesnt feel like a PB but I'm sure she is.  She's close to one I got a couple yeas back, but I dont have an official weight on either.  I need to start bringing a digital scale to confirm.  Caught in 112ft. The best part was watching her swim away!!
Wow, what a tank, congrats
Sweet fish...  Congratulations...
Awesome Steve !!!!!! that is a beauty !!!! I'd say  close to 15 lbs ?
holy cow!.. I say that thing is a beast lolz nice fish man!... cant wait to go out....
That things a beast and congrats on the PB.  Got to love how people have no brains and all run over when you catch one fish. It a wonder why people lose there lives out on the ice.
I would have to agree, we estimated 15-16 lbs.
That's a tank Steve!!!  A buddy of mine got spooled the other day.  Would have been nice to see that fish.
beauty fish Steve! Congrats!!!!
what a tanker !!!! congrats steve
That is a beauty , well done Steve . That fish is a good 15 lbs and glad to hear it swam away
Wow. That is one fine fish.
That is a real beauty. Six or eight inch hole?
Great fish. Congrats  Lots of herring for them to eat thats forsure.
Nice fish buddy, The lake has a really good population of those 12lbs fish this year...  Any other pics of that fish by chance?
Wow! Thats a tank man!   TDunn
Nice fish!  Too bad I don't have the cojones to hit the deep water yet....not sure how you can feel comfortable standing on 3" of ice above 100+ feet of freezing water, lol!
Ya, I feel the same way standing on the glass floor at the CN tower. Although in this case 10 feet or 100 feet makes very little difference.
Nice fighting fish....
man what a fish. Makes me think one of these days I'll have to try the lake trout thing
Nice fish, Steve! Real purdy!!
Great fish!!!
awesome fish but you won't catch me on that skinny ice
Beauty fish Steve!
B-E-A-U-T-Y !!!!  Congrats on your PB!
